scenario_text.value: Ugh... Ah, UWAHHH!
Takuma! The professor’s here!
Is he seeing some sort of illusion?!

No, no I...I didn’t... I didn’t abandon
her...!

Professor! Come on, snap out of it,
Professor!
Hah!
*huff* *huff* *huff*...!

You’re drenched in sweat, Professor. Are you
okay?

I’m...I’m all right. I just lost my head for
a moment there.

I saw a vision... Although I suppose its
subject was too contrived to call it that.

That wasn’t just a hallucination...
It was crafted with intention.

Perhaps to hurt and weaken me? Drive me
into a corner, but without breaking me?

To think that I would be shown such a thing
as well... What could the reason be?

(The professor...seems composed, but a bit
frail, too. He must be exhausted.)
Uh, Professor...
Takuma. I know I’ve mentioned it before...
But please, allow me to reiterate.
Ah, yeah, go for it!
My name is Akiharu Minase.

Haru for short...and brother to Miyuki
Minase, who went missing 50 years ago.

What? Miyuki is your sister, Professor?
You’re Haru?!

(Between the professor’s behavior, Miyuki’s
words, and the photo... I had a feeling.)

(Still, it sounds weird to hear it come out
of his mouth.)

About Miyuki being my sister, and Haru taking
on my appearance in my youth...

I had deemed this information unnecessary for
returning to our world...

Rather, I felt it too burdensome of a truth
for you all, and thus avoided the subject.

Jijimon said it himself. Calling out to
Miyuki is a stopgap measure at best.

Sooner or later, we’ll have to defeat her. If
that’s true...

Then the knowledge that you two are siblings
would cause everyone to hesitate.

I thought as much myself. Still, my assumption
may have been misguided.

Now I feel as if...it’s about time to tell
everyone.

(Still, with everything going on at the
moment, it’s utter chaos in here.)
(Is now really the best time...?)

(We should at least wait until things calm
down before he opens that can of worms.)
(Should we tell everyone about the professor?)
Absolutely.
No way.
Not right now.

So, we should tell them...about
your relation to Miyuki...and Haru?

Right. I must have been wrong to
think they don’t need to know.

I don’t think you were wrong, Professor. It
would have just confused them...
Isn’t it better to keep this a secret?

I, too, thought as much for a long time...
That assumption may have been flawed, though.

We don’t know what will happen next... Now,
more than ever, I believe they should know.

I agree that you should talk with everyone,
it’s just...maybe wait until things are calm?

I don’t anticipate any good coming from
putting it off any further, do you?

At the very least, this story is deeply
connected to Renamon over there.

Renamon’s hatred, and his alliance with the
Master, may be related to my past.

If Miyuki is the key to saving everything,
then my circumstances are of consequence.

That’s why if we get out of this library
safely, I want to tell everyone everything.

About me, my sister... Everything, from the
very beginning.
Professor... You’ve remembered, then?
Yes, indeed I have.

You have my thanks for keeping mum up to now.
I’m sorry for putting you in that position.

But first, we must get everyone back to base
in one piece.
All right.

We know where everyone is. All we have to do
now is escape together!

It’s just... Aoi’s in a rough place,
emotionally, so...

Aoi...? She has been deeply pained by the
loss of dear Saki...

And it seems she was shown a vision
of Saki that really threw her for a loop.

All the more reason to accelerate our
timeline, wouldn’t you say?

Sure. We’ve got to get out of here and help
Aoi calm down!

We still don’t know where everyone is.
Could you help us track them down?

Considering Aoi’s condition...we’d better
hurry.

She has been deeply affected by the loss of
dear Saki...

We ought to leave this place immediately and
take her somewhere she can rest.
You’re right, no time to lose!

Yes, by all means. Let’s give it everything
we’ve got.
